result.execSummary:
The defendant John C Fears was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

$500 bail applied. Remaining balance of costs and restitution to be paid while on supervision. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
No contact with any merchant in Ozaukee County.
Submit to DNA sample.
Pay supervision fees.
-6- days credit, if revoked.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 14CF236 and Milwaukee County Case 14CF3674

superMiscConds.notes: The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 50% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Pay supervision fees.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 14CF236 and Milwaukee County Case 14CF3674
